meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a heavy blow.
meanings.sent1: He walloped the ball with all his might.
meanings.sent2: The boxer walloped his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: The chef walloped the dough to make the perfect bread.
meanings.sent4: The storm walloped the coast with strong winds and rain.
meanings.sent5: The hammer walloped the nail into the wood effortlessly.

meanings.sent1: The wrestler received a walloping to the head.
meanings.sent2: The tree took a walloping from the strong winds.
meanings.sent3: The cake received a walloping of frosting for decoration.
meanings.sent4: The car's bumper suffered a walloping in the accident.
meanings.sent5: The pirate captain gave the disobedient crew member a walloping as punishment.

meanings.definition: Very large or impressive in size or amount.
meanings.sent1: The walloping waves crashed against the shore.
meanings.sent2: The walloping elephant stood majestically in the savanna.
meanings.sent3: The walloping cake towered over the other desserts at the party.
meanings.sent4: The walloping mountain loomed in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The walloping fireworks display lit up the night sky with vibrant colors.
